FuncDef:
The snmp-agent trap disable command disables an AP from sending trap messages.
The undo snmp-agent trap disable command restores the default configuration.
The snmp-agent trap enable command enables an AP to send trap messages.
The undo snmp-agent trap enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, some modules of an AP are enabled to send trap messages. You can run the display snmp-agent trap all command to check whether modules of an AP are enabled to send trap messages.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In port extension scenarios, to disable or enable all modules of an AP from sending trap messages, run the snmp-agent trap disable command on a master.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
Extended error codes are Huawei-specific. The extended error code function can be configured to extend standard error codes only when an NMS is a Huawei NMS and managed AP devices are Huawei devices. Extended error codes facilitate fault locating.
